text: I was at the Battle of Britain Memorial
yesterday i was there out of respect for
that amazing moment in British history I
was also thinking about my family my mom
and dad who were there at that time in
London and worked as air raid warden
wardens air raid wardens during the
Blitz and I was thinking about that and
it was a respectful ceremony and I stood
in respect throughout it but just to be
clear members of your shadow cabinet
been trying to defend it and struggling
to defend it are you saying that you
will sing the national anthem the future
I'm going to be at many events and I'll
take part fully in those events I don't
see a problem about this the issue
surely is that we had a memorial for the
battle brim i was there i showed respect
for it and i'll show respect in the
proper way at all future events that's
what i'll be doing and it's the proper
way singing the national highways to
take a full part in and i'll take a full
part in prime minister's questions today
what can we expect from the first jeremy
corbyn Prime Minister's Questions well
you have to wait you got just over an
hour to go but I want things to be
rather different because I think the
public as a whole have had enough of yah
boo sucks theatrical politics and that's
what I'm going to try and bring to PMQs
today it's going to be interesting I
don't expect it's going to be easy but
then our job is to hold government to
account our job is to speak up for
ordinary people all over the country and
the day-to-day problems they're facing
in their lives and that is the function
of Parliament it's not a club or should
not be a club and I will try and treat
it with the respect it deserves
